answers.answer: Hi there. Lupus is associated with the symptoms of Reynaud’s phenomenon which is pale or purplish discoloration of fingers and toes from stress or cold. It can occur as a primary condition or secondary condition( example secondary to lupus, scleroderma and rheumatoid arthritis). other possibilities of burning sensation in toes and fingers is nerve entrapment, multiple sclerosis, strokes, migraines, spinal stenosis, diabetes, Reynaud’s syndrome itself, arthritis and ulnar nerve dysfunction. spinal stenosis and burning hand syndrome, B12 deficiency etc. you need to consult a neurologist for the investigation of these possibilities and confirmation if this is due to Reynaud’s phenomenon. You will need to keep your fingers and toes warm, protect from cold, trauma and infection. Avoid barefoot walking and tight fitting wristbands, rings, footwear, etc. avoid direct and indirect smoking and medicines like nitroglycerin ointment are used for topical application on prescription. Take care.
